case.title: Go to the main page of the site by clicking on the main logo
Check title for layout
Check text for spelling errors
Check the number of tags
Check clicking tag opens articles with that tag
Check that by clicking on the tag the channel is sorted and the channel opens
Check that articles are sorted by publication date
Сheck user photo display
Check that after clicking on "Read more..." link the user gets to the article page"
Check that when you click on the "Like" icon, the number of likes changes
Сheck that the transition to the selected page in pagination is carried out
The user goes to the login form after clicking on the "Sign in" link on the main page of the site
The authorization page on the site contains two text fields - one for entering the email address / username, the other for entering the password and the [Sign In] button.
Go to the registration page when clicking "Need an account?" link
Authorization error when entering characters (",%,?, *, Etc.) in the email field
Authorization error in the absence of the "@" sign in the email
Error entering email for unregistered user
Data can be deleted after entering in the field "Email"
Data can be inserted in the "Email" field
Lower and upper case letters can be entered in the "Email" field (Abcd)
The user is authorized when entering the password with which he is registered
Authorization error on the site when entering a nonexistent password
Password mask in the form of dots when entering data in the "Password" field
User can delete data from "Password" field
User can edit data from "Password" field
he user can insert data in the "Password" field
User logs in to the site after clicking on "Sign in" button
The user can enter Latin letters in the field
User can enter lower and upper case Latin letters in the field(AbCd)
"Username" field is not case sensitive (test=TEST)
An error occurred while entering a nonexistent name in the "Username" field
The username can be inserted into the "Username" field
The data in the "Username" field can be deleted from the line
User can registered in to the site with valid data.
An error message appears for fields marked as mandatory if you leave the fields "e-mail", "Username" empty
An error message appears for fields marked as mandatory if you leave the field "Username" empty
An error message appears for fields marked as mandatory if you leave the field "e-mail" empty
An error message appears for fields marked as mandatory if you leave the fields "e-mail", "Confirm password" empty
Error message when entering 3 Latin letters
User can create a username from 4 Latin letters
User can create a username from 5 Latin letters
User can create a username from 35 Latin letters
User can create a username from 36 Latin letters
Error message when entering 37 Latin letters
The user can create a username from Latin letters in upper and lower case in the "Username" field ("AbCd")
Error message in the "Username" window when entering the letters of the Cyrillic alphabet
Error message when entering special characters (", No.,;,:,?,%, Etc.)
Entered spaces before and after the main text are truncated. Correct data display: "Username"
An error message appears stating that the user with the specified name is already registered in the system when entering the registered name
Data is valid using the "spaces" and "-"
Data were validated by entering an email in the format [name]@[domain].[top-domain] (test@mail.com)
An error message appears about the incorrect format of the E-mail address in the absence of the "@" sign
An error message appears about the incorrect format of the E-mail address in the absence of the "." sign
Error messages appear about the incorrect format of the E-mail address when you enter special characters (%,:,?, *, Etc.) in the email field except for the characters: @,., +
Data is validated in the email field when entering Latin upper and lower case letters(AbC@mail.com)
Data is validated in the email field when you enter numbers in the field(123@mail.com)
An error message appears stating that the user with the specified E-mail is already registered in the system when entering an already registered E-mail
Error message when entering 3 characters in the password field
Error message when entering 31 characters in the password field
Password is successfully validated by entering 4 characters in the field
Password is successfully validated by entering 5 characters in the field
Password is successfully validated by entering 29 characters in the field
Password is successfully validated by entering 30 characters in the field
Password successfully passes validation when entering numbers in the "Password" field
Password successfully passes validation when entering Latin letters in the "Password" field
Password successfully passes validation when entering special characters in the "Password" field (@,#,^, Etc.)
When you enter values ​​in the Password field, the data is masked with dots.
Near the field, there is a special symbol "*"
Error message if there is no data in the "Password" field
When entering numbers, a capital letter and a symbol, the data in the password field is validated
Error message if there is no digit in the "Password" field
Error message if there is no capital letter in the "Password" field
Error message if there is no sign in the "Password" field
An error message appears that the data in the fields "Password" and "Confirm password" do not match each other when entering different data
Data is encrypted with dots when entering data in the "Confirm password" field
Check image display
Check font and alignment of article text

Enter 240 characters in the field

The user successfully creates an article if the required fields "Article Title", "What's this article about?", "Write your article (in markdown)" are filled with data after clicking the [Publish Article] button
An error is displayed if the required fields "Article Title", "What's this article about?", "Write your article (in markdown)" are not filled with data after clicking the [Publish Article] button
Data disappears from the filled windows if the user does not click on the [Publish Article] button and goes to another page of the site
After successful publication of an article, the user gets redirected to the User's Article page.
User profile is available after authorization on the site.
The user can get to the page from the “My Articles” tab on the user’s page
The user can go to the page from the Global Channel tab (if you are logged in as an author) on the user’s page.
User can get to the User article page by creating an article
User article page consists of Title of the article, User’s avatar and name, Date of publication, “Edit article” button, “Delete article” button
Title of the article corresponds to the created title
The username corresponds to the user who owns the page
Check user photo display
Date corresponds to the publication date of the article.
